title: TV news at the conferences
brief_description: This is a case study on British politics and television, shot during the 1976 Labour and Conservative Party conferences held in Blackpool and Brighton respectively. Concentrates on the way the BBC news covered three events of these conferences - the Prime Minister’s speech at the Labour Conference, and Mr Heath’s and Mrs Thatcher’s speeches at the Conservative Conference. Narrated by Michael Smee.
